title: Grungy handwritten font
content:
Hi,

can anyone help me id-ing this grungy handwritten font used by Scotch and Soda?  
Thanks a lot!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Schermafbeelding 2013-03-04 om 14.27.33.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323140725/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermafbeelding%202013-03-04%20om%2014.27.33.png) | 156.24 KB |
| [Schermafbeelding 2013-03-04 om 14.13.06.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323140725/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermafbeelding%202013-03-04%20om%2014.13.06.png) | 21.1 KB |
author: Perron 9

comments.content: Exactly what your post title is stating, handwritten, meaning not-a-font. All repeating letters are different. Some suggestions for alternatives: [http://typophile.com/node/100949](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323140725/http:/typophile.com/node/100949 "http://typophile.com/node/100949"), [http://typophile.com/node/96125](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323140725/http:/typophile.com/node/96125 "http://typophile.com/node/96125")

Thanks Ryuk!  
I know. It just seems hard to believe that these kind of company's have every little thing (like banners on websites) handmade ...
